metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23995 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
When Responsive Design Mode was enabled, it used references to objects thatwere previously freed. We presume that with enough effort this could havebeen exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects FirefoxESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
